Reviews.Title: “Good location but ....”
Reviews.Author: 4theluvoflife
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance near must see sights. Unfortunately, the rooms are terrible with very uncomfortable beds and the bathroom had such a horrible sewer smell that I had to buy a candle to cope with the odor, since I wasn’t about to ruin my trip over such a discrepancy in the hotel choice. The hotel towels are like a napkin, rather than the type of cloth generally used for towels, and was very rough to dry yourself with. The breakfast was very bad as well. Unfortunately, I don’t have anything nice to say about this place apart from the fact that it has a good location. It’s one of the worse hotels I have ever stayed at. Stayed November 2010

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel with excellent staff in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Travelexperience12
Reviews.Content: criteria was proximity to the Termini Station, where trains and buses arrive from the airport. It was an easy walk of approximately 10 minutes. The reception was friendly and businesslike. The lift is a little small and our room was basic, but quite suitable for our stay. One point worth noting is that the shower facility in the room was quite small. Cleaning is to a high standard, including the public areas. The buffet breakfast is also basic, but provides a good start to the day. We liked the bread and croissants, which were fresh and very good. One improvement would be the provision of some fruit in addition to the other offerings. Internet access is available at an extremely low cost of €2 for 20 hours Following our passports being stolen, our departure from Rome was delayed whilst we obtained replacements. In these circumstances, the hotel was especially helpful in accommodating us independently at very short notice, for a further two nights, and also assisting us in ongoing contact with our travel operator. The general location is quite good for the main attractions and our overall experience of this hotel was positive. We would definitely stay here again if in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: Krustymitchell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Paria for 3 nights at the end of March, we found the hotel clean, beds comfy and the staff helpful. Breakfast was continental, bread rolls, crossiants, cereal, yoghurt etc. We are not big fans of this but the food was plentiful. There was no facilites in the rooms for drinks but if you either asked reception on your way up to your room for hot drink or rang down they provided this for you. The best part of this hotel for us was its location, a short walk to the bus and metro station, and then convenient for the sight seeing we did. Just take comfy walking shoes and enjoy meandering around Rome enjoying the sights, people and atmosphere. Across the road from the hotel is an arcade and there is a deli type shop in there, the ice cream and coffee were excellent the cakes and pastries looked gorgeous and it opened late into the evening. On our first day took the number 10 sighteeing bus to get our bearings, the ticket we bought was valid for 2 days to hop on and off. We found this useful but once we knew our way round didn't use it just walked. Your map reading needs to be good but the hotel provided us with one. We would certainly go back to Rome and stay in this hotel again, no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nicola W
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights in October. The location was brilliant, coukdn't ask for anything more! Rooms were clean and bathroom seemed quite modern compared to the rest of the hotel. Reception staff very friendly and althoughh we weren't meant to be checked in until 3pm they checked us in at 11am! Going to Rome again this week and was going to stay here but slightly more expensive this time of year but would definitely go back if the price was right. Booked bed and breakfast but didn't try the breakfast so cannot judge.

Reviews.Title: “rome city break”
Reviews.Author: metroman60
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a three night stay at the hotel patria ,on the plus side it isin a great location we were able to walk to most tourist sites OR wecould walk 200 mt to the metro station or 500mts to termini the main bus and metro station the biggest plus is DENNIS the GENTLEMAN on reception nothing was to much bother no question went unanswerd his knowledge of rome was of great help to my wife and i Breakfast was more than adequate to keep us going untill lunch now for the down side ,we were given the smallest hotel room we have ever had ,the shower was just big enough to turn around in ,but had i been a big guy it would have been impossible, the towels( such as they were )were changed every day and the room was clean. so all in all we would recommend this hotel our criticism is minor and we did enjoy our stay

Reviews.Title: “City Break in Roma 7 March”
Reviews.Author: silvialoky
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a City Break in Roma at Hotel Patria . We stayed there between 7 - 10 Mach for 3 nights , 4 dbl rooms . The Hotel is central located about 20 min walk to Fontana di Trevi and the Metro station Repubblica is 2 min walk . The people at the Front Desk are nice and helpful fell free to ask anything and they will help you . They have internet but you have to buy with a Credit Card via a computer, I have try ed to bye it from my Phone but it did not work . The elevator is small , it can only fit 2 ppl with bags or 4 ppl :) . If you stay on the 5'th Floor you have to take the stairs 1 level because the elevator only reaches Level 4 . The Rooms are small in size about 14 m2 , but clean and you have everything you need , TV , minibar, safe , telephone , a small bathroom with shower etc . The Breakfast is ok but not very divers everyday you have : Cornflakes , milk , jam , ham 2 types , cheese , butter , croissants . The Coffee is not particularly good and you have Pineapple juise . Nearby are shops and restaurants , one nice Rest is very close to the Hotel ( just 2 m down the street ) we eat there on our last night and we were very pleased . I recomand this hotel to anyone that is not claustrofobic .

Reviews.Title: “City break”
Reviews.Author: idixon98
Reviews.Content: A great location about ten mins walk from the termini main station and just off the main road nationale. A reasonable sized room for the two of us with a safe and a Tv. The bathroom was good including a hair dryer and all essentials. The towels were a cross between kitchen paper and pillow cases so bring your own unless you enjoy an all over exfoliation after your shower. We were on the fourth floor and used the lift. The staff were all very nice and friendly especially on the desk. In the breakfast room the choice was simple but enough for us. Two cereals, croissaints, bread, cheese and ham. Tea, coffee and juice. We would stay here again as it is only fifteen to twenty minutes walk to most places of interest. Just around the corner was a great restaurant that we used twice. The 110 open top bus is hop on and hop off so we used that to get around.

Reviews.Title: “really good”
Reviews.Author: Gwil186233
Reviews.Content: Clean sheets and towels each day. Staff very helpful and central for all we wished to do. We had really cold weather when we were there but room was warm. Would recommend to anyone. Breakfast was plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: 16Carolyn
Reviews.Content: A very small room, but comfortable and well-staffed hotel. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “s kerr englandBrilliant holiday”
Reviews.Author: steve k
Reviews.Content: This hotel was centraly placed for all major sight seing venues. very close to bus and train station we recomend the open top bus tour purchase the 48 hour ticket so you can see more, thwhich gives you insight into which atractions you would prever to visit, the staff will gladly help you with this.The hotel was very clean and the breakfast had a great selection of items for being a continental breakfast. The staff were very helpful and obliging and always willing to give you a quick lesson in speaking italian. the jewel in the hotel crown is Dennis the hotel receptionist who is fluently multi linqual, eager to assist guests and very knowledgable about shops and local attractions. there are some very good coffee bars and restauraunts within two minutes walk from this hotel. word of warning beware of the traffic and the scooters. Rome is ideal for adults but is not very good for young children as there is nothing for them to keep them occupied. we had a very pleasant stay and cant wait to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ReneNZ
Reviews.Content: Like many of you do, and are likely doing now, I use Trip adviser for a good honest opinion of Hotels. With Hotel Patria, it is good Value for money considering the Location. The Staff were friendly and Helpful, the rooms were clean and tidy, the breakfast was what you could expect. What more could you ask for. I would recommend this hotel to people.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: 13_Eleni
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for the city center standards in this category... I booked it through the hotels web site that gave an early booking discount, cheaper then other booking sites. The rooms were recently renovated but rather small. Breakfast was served till 09:30 although it mentioned till 10:00 in the web side, very basic, continental. The location was just perfect, just a street down of piazza de la Republica, within walking distance of all the major attractions. I would stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but quite adequate”
Reviews.Author: Stephen B
Reviews.Content: Clean room, cheap wifi (get the 2euro for 24 hr use deal, lasts for ages). Nice fresh breakfast. Walking distance to lots of Romes attractions. Good value. Helpful reception. Worlds smallest elevator.. Two people, not enough room for bags. We were on the fifth floor and the lift only goes to the forth floor.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Annette Lykke J
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel is SO friendly and helpfull and they make you feel very welcome. We stayed at room 101, which was a REALLY large room and there was plenty of room for all of us 3 grownups. The room was cleaned every day and we got fresh towels every day also. After 2 days the linnen was changed, eventhough it wasn't dirty. It is 2 min. away from Via Nationale where all the shops are, and it's 5 min. away from the Central Station Termini. The street is quiet and you are just minutes away from all the restaurants, bars and shops. We recommend this hotel 110%

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: polarhbear
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms, nice staff but breakfast was terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: NikiCoogeeAustralia
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here 3 nights after a long flight from Australia, we couldn't check in till 2 which is fair enough but we were offered breakfast & could leave our bags while we explored the great attractions that were within walking distance. It is a fantastic location, close to a metro around the corner & termini station was only 10mins walk away. Staff were helpful & friendly at times, breakfast was limited but fresh & nice. The rooms were tiny but very clean & I guess its what you expect for cities like Rome /paris- small expensive rooms. It was about 30degrees c everyday so it would have been nice if the air-con could go a bit colder but it was comfortable by the time you relaxed after a big day walking. Nice clean hotel, small but you'll spend more time sight seeing in Rome and a bed is all you need really, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and a great position”
Reviews.Author: basinboy
Reviews.Content: I had read a few negative reviews about this place, but we had no complaints. You usually get what you pay for in expensive capital cities, so we were never expecting spacious rooms and 4/5 star trappings. What we got was a clean room with a view. The breakfasts were OK, a lot of people seemed to like them, many were filling handbags and pockets with bits and pieces of food for a free lunch, I wonder if some of these people posted reviews complaining about the quality of the breakfasts lol. The staff at reception were friendly and helpful, in particular one blond guy, with a german accent. Somebody mentioned the wierd towels, yes they were strange, more like a tea towel, but they were very absorbent, so no problem. The area, ten minutes walk from Termini, and less than 5 minutes to the nearest metro was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Please stay away from Hotel Patria Rome”
Reviews.Author: ande88
Reviews.Content: Please save yourself from sleepless nights. It is because at dawn time blood sucking bed bugs came out and are very mobile biting you. I was woken up at 0300 hours to find about ten bed bugs crawling on my head, and on my right arm. I was horrified of what I saw and just sat on the chair till the morning. One bed bug even went to the bathroom. The carpet is moist, dirty and looks mouldy. I wrote to the management the following day and they transferred me to another room that has the same very old, worn out tiny single bed. My breakfast was included in my four nights stay but missed breakfast because they open 7:30 and my tour started at 6:30 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LeamSpa89
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at the Patria for 5 nights in June. Firstly the location of this hotel is great, about 2 mins walk to the nearest underground station and within walking distance of many shops, bars and restaurants. In terms of key Rome "attractions" the hotel is either walking distance from them or a short underground ride away. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was basic but very clean and comfortable. the only "negative" was that the breakfast each morning was quite limited with not much choice but overall i would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay somewhere clean, comfortable and on a budget in Rome. A great little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It and will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Kyleaffd
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It is walking distance from the train station (10 Min), Roman Forum/Coliseum (15 Min Slow Walk) and 2 Min from the closest Metro (Subway). The rooms are not overly decorated or large but who goes to Rome to say in the Hotel… The staff is great, always willing to work with me on finding places to go and eat. If you have more than two people multiple rooms are required but they are reasonably priced. I have made two trips to Roma and love this hotel both times.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough room to swing a cat.”
Reviews.Author: TiggerAl
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, small beds, cramped breakfast room, no lift after fourth floor. Breakfast a bit of a bun fight and barely worth the effort. Staff did their best to be friendly and helpful despite the poor facilities. Location very good and close to transport.

Reviews.Title: “Small uncomfortable room, but close to attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Kristy_Burns
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights during our honeymoon and when our first 2 hotels had us in a double bed, it was king sized, this bed was just a double. The room was so small, it was hard for either of us to get around in it. The shower was even smaller. I'm 5'2" and 110 pounds and I could barely turn around in the shower. The plus was that breakfast was included and the front desk helped us with any questions we had. Even the elevator was tiny, hardly able to fit 2 people with luggage in!

Reviews.Title: “Petite Hotel close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: Startrekker13
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel, close to shopping via nazonale and attractions. The continental breackfast was very good with a variety of cereals and pasteries. Our room needed to be refurbished it was like stepping into a time warp. However saying this it was clean and comfortable and quite, no road noise at all. It has a small lift and we found it difficult with our bags to get in and out as it only takes 3 persons. Their is no storage room for suitcases if you are checking in early or wanting to leave your case the security is not their. The foyer is small and no brochures on display for attractions or day trips to do. We found it a bit disappointing but the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest hotel about their “total rate” – good location”
Reviews.Author: GSTgst
Reviews.Content: Bad points- • They are dishonest about the total price of their hotel room. They collect, in cash (no credit cards), a 2 Euro/night “local tax” upon checkout. Sound suspicious? At worst, they are crooks. At best, they are incompetent because neither their website nor their e-mail confirmation mentioned anything about this secret tax payable in cash upon checkout. I sat in the lobby using their WIFI for a little bit and they stung everyone checking out, including four elderly ladies who had no more Euros upon leaving for the airport (they had to go to an ATM). A person would assume the “total price” in the written confirmation is the total price. BAD! BAD! BAD! • WIFI is NOT in every room in the hotel, despite their advertising that it is. The dead spots are well known to the front desk. The hotel was full, so they could not move me to another room. There was no refund of the amount already paid for “hotel wide” WIFI. • The front desk staff seems indifferent. It’s almost like you are an interruption to their job. • The carpets are deep green and clearly show what has been vacuumed and what has not. They need to do some serious edge vacuuming in this place. • Continental Breakfast is included, but ends way too early – 9A (even on a Sunday!) Hardy anyone takes advantage of it because of the early end time. • Update to the above: They do extend breakfast until 9:30A on Sunday, but they post the extension notice on Sunday morning at 7A – how stupid! • The towels are weird – they aren’t common bathroom towels but more like tablecloths (and they don’t absorb that well either). • My shower was tiny. Think phone booth, then think smaller. I couldn’t even turn around it was so small. Good points- • Previous reviews have noted uncomfortable beds. I found mine to be quite nice. • The overall hotel is nice – it looks reasonably modern for the area. • Great location (easy walking distance from train station – although don’t follow the instructions on the hotels website and take the subway – it is ridiculous to take the subway for that short distance).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for explore Rome, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Majarao
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, close to the station, access to the Metro as well, very helpfull staff and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location ...”
Reviews.Author: Suzi1948
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in terms of customer service ~ nothing was too much trouble from any member of staff. Excellent location for getting around Rome ~ better than I ever expected. Close to Termini Station ~ 5 min walk. Close to some nice bars and restaurants. Room was small and clean but we needed lights on all the time, so probably not the best room in the hotel, and certainly with no view at all. The air con didn't work ~ only gives out heat it seems; doesn't cool so we had to have windows open and that created a noise problem! Breakfast ~ typical basic continental type.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for Money hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ThanosTs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 days. The room was very clean (changed the towels and sheets every day), small but comfortable. The reception was most helpful , very very polite. The location of the hotel is UNBELIEVABLE. It's in an alley on a main street, so it's quiet at night. The bus stop is right outside, and the metro station too!! Also it's just 5minutes walk from the Termini station. Wireless internet cost me 2euros for the entire stay, and was very fast with excelent signal in the room. Breakfast was typical. We were delighted with our stay, and i will definetely recomend it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, great location.”
Reviews.Author: NikosRHO
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome and I looked for a hotel to be near 'everywhere'. So there it was Patria hotel, 5' walk from termini, less the a minute a metro,and about 15' on Via nationale to reach the center of Rome, colosseum and everything you need ti see. Hot water, air-condition and clean towels, sheets every day. The personal was friendly too.it's an excellent choice. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Old, budget hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: matthewams
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location and is just a couple of blocks away from the metro. You can easily walk to most sites as well which was what we did for the most part. As for the room, it's really old and as others have mentioned, they were rather small. The bathroom likely received minor updating 5 years ago. Don't expect too much. The breakfast isn't much, but at least they will make you a fresh cappuccino when you ask; do avoid the coffee in the thermos. Overall, it's in a good location with lots of restaurants nearby. It's certainly a budget hotel and keep that in mind when you book.

Reviews.Title: “Good until the maid ate my Parisian macarons (wtf?)”
Reviews.Author: Crystalantler
Reviews.Content: I was initially pretty pleased with this hotel. Great location, clean rooms, okay breakfast, etc. However, I left a box of very expensive French macarons that I had purchased in Paris on the table...And when I returned to my room in the afternoon, the box was open, and several of the macarons were missing. I wouldn't have minded so much if it had been a box of regular cookies, but the macarons were a delicacy that I had long planned to buy when given the opportunity to finally visit Paris. Furthermore, I am now concerned about the safety of my other belongings. I will not be recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CherylT4
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel in Rome if funds are tight. It was quite basic but met our needs. The rooms are tiny. We requested and paid for a triple room but got a double room with a twin bed squeezed into it.. They claimed that was their triple room! My two friends and I could not walk around the room and were barely able to squeeze between the beds. The bathroom we had was modern and newly renovated however. Breakfast was very basic continental. The only fruit served was fruit cocktail....daily!! The hotel is centrally located, about two blocks from Termini station and around the corner from the subway and buses. You can walk to some attractions and there were lots of restaurants and shops around.

Reviews.Title: “Patria Hotel - Middle of the Road”
Reviews.Author: Brian1311
Reviews.Content: An old hotel in Rome (arnt they all). Staff were friendly and spoke multiple languages, room was tight and air con struggled to keep up with the volume required. Food was boring and eating area was small during peek periods. WiFi was free but had lots of problems with it cutting out etc. Close to the Republican Fountain which was a good spot to pick up public travel. Close to restaurants. Hotel has elevator to the 4th floor but not the 5th. It is just another hotel that does not impress or disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “An apology for an allegedly "3 Star Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Corky871
Reviews.Content: After visiting Venice and Florence, we arrived in Roma and went to our hotel. What a terrible disappointment!!! Our room was extemely small with virtually no natural daylight and a window view of a building site, littered with rubble and other debris. This room was very dirty with skirting boards and radiator cover thick with dust! The bathroom was very small with a shower which was about to expire, with water leaking out from everywhere but the shower-head! We noticed that the house maids appeared to be on an economy drive with great reluctance to replace soap, shampoo, toilet rolls and ladies hygiene bags (only 1 supplied during a 5 night stay!). Like the bedroom, this room was also never cleaned properly during the entire stay. Breakfast was little short of a culinary disaster every morning with a choice of food which lacked any imagination, with the same items layed out each morning. (Not even any cheese!!!). Staff in the Breakfast Room were morose to the point of severe rudeness and appeared disinterested in the extreme and were unable to even acknowledge the arrival of any hotel guests. The one exeception in all of this appalling senario lay with one of the reception staff, a Ukrainian gentlemen who was polite and as helpful as was possible, given the constraints of his working enviroment and the apparent hotel policy of ignoring guests whenever possible. He was an absolute delight and was the one and only saving grace at this disgusting excuse for a Roman Hotel. Honestly, go there at your peril and try if you can to prove us wrong!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Italy Visit”
Reviews.Author: nks1947
Reviews.Content: Hotel Patria, Rome Italy This was fifth and last stop for me and my wife during our trip to Italy in Sep 2010, we stayed here for 3 days, 2 nights. After a great vacation and good hotels in Italy, Patria was pathetic. The double room we were given in this so called three star hotel was no way a place to stay for two people. Cramped up toilet, hardly any space for accommodating even one medium bag and dingy look, blocked window. I don’t think it was fit enough to be a one star hotel room! We initially thought all rooms in the hotel were alike, but on the second day we saw some rooms open for house keeping and they were of reasonable size with natural light from windows. We asked the front office if they had different categories of rooms, to our astonishment we were told hotel had only standard rooms. Mind it we were given this room when we had made advance booking 2 months before arrival. Also it was not the only room allotted or available at that time; 3 or 4 couples checked in at the same time as us but we, in spite of 2 months advance booking, were given the room as described above. It could possibly a racial bias towards us being Indians, as we can think of, since other couples checking in with us appeared to be Americans. The stay here took all charm of our wonderful stay in Italy. Only saving grace was that English speaking front office staff was not bad and location is good. Naresh Sethi, India

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: bennett_laura
Reviews.Content: Good location in Rome, friendly staff, nice rooms. Was a short walk out of the city. Veyr close the the train and metro stations!! Was quiet at night as it was located that little bit out of the city, would definitely recommend this hotel to families. Had to pay a couple of euro for internet but it was fast and there were no troubles with it

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rmpbrasil
Reviews.Content: Although it is located in a central part of Rome the noise of traffic of the city are not heard. It is very close to the metro', the bus stops, the main train station, shops, walking distance to the Fontana de Trevi. The metro costs $1.00 euro one way.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: geofun
Reviews.Content: Great room. It was spacious with plenty of room. The location was great. We walked with all of our luggage to and from Roma Termini train station. The metro station was even closer. We were able to sight see all over Rome and stop back at the hotel during the day without being inconvenienced.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: xxVikkixx
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in november 2009. The accommodation was ok, but i didnt expect a 5* hotel. We were put into a small corner box room, but we could hardly move so went down to reception who moved us later that day once a new room had been cleaned and this room was massive in comparsion. Hotel was in a great location, off the main rome street, where all the restuarants and shops were and within walking distance to the main sightseeing parts of rome. The accommodation was nice but basic, but i suppose thats all you need in Rome when your going for a city break, as you hardly spend any time in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Near Metro Republica”
Reviews.Author: sangko21
Reviews.Content: though my room was small, it was clean. The place is close to the main avenue and very accessibe to metro and bus. The staff were friendly and helpful. I am very happy with my stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: CharmNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed there after travelling much of Europe and considering we had some pretty adverage hotels we were not expecting miracles with this hotel. We found it okay. It was a little musty but you got use to that quickly. The room was a good size the bed was comfortable enough the bathroom was a good size and clean. The staff were friendly to us and were very help with any questions we had. We found the location good. Decent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “In my experience great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: mtek
Reviews.Content: I am just back this afternoon after 4 nights in Rome when I stayed at the hotel Patria. I have been in Rome several times and always book one of the three star hotels near Termini Station - after all Rome is itself the major star and a hotel is just somewhere to sleep in. Because of the booking sites I use to book hotels in Europe I have stayed in 3 - 4 hotels in or around the station and this was one of the best. I arrived in Rome on Thursday hot, sweaty and tired after a very early flight from Dublin. I had read the reviews on Tripadvisor and seen the negative comments but was not concerned because the positive comments appeared more balanced. The walk from Termini Station drop off point for the Terravision coach from Ciampino Airport is down on Via Marsala. Its about a 10 minute walk to the hotel. I use the Metro a lot in Rome and could have used it for the transfer to Repubblica but with a medium sized trolly case and the steep escalators in Repubblica I thought it better to walk. Check in time in Italian hotels can be as late as 2pm but I arrived at the Patria a few minutes after 12 noon. I fully expected to have to leave the case and go off and have lunch and come back later to check in. However the wonderful desk clerk told me that my room was ready so after the check in process I entered a tiny lift that took me to the 4th floor. As many hotels are in what could be classed "listed buildings" the lifts cannot be on the scale one finds in airports/hospitals or other public buildings. My room was Room 411. It had a strange (but not unsatisfactory) layout. The single bed was against a wall half of which was mirrored which made the room look bigger on entering. There was a reasonable sized wardrobe with safety deposit, extra pillow and blankets (which were not necessary). A bedside locker was next to the bed with the phone, radio controls and bedside light switch beside or on same. There was a long dressing table with a shallow drawer and a flat screen TV on the top. The room was L-shaped and the shower was actually in the room just opposite the bathroom. The room was clean and the mini bar had a couple of soft drinks, water, beer but no spirits. Prices are displayed on a laminate underneath the glass topped dressing table. The bathroom had a toilet in an awkward position next to the sink on one side and bidet on the other. The hotel is just around the corner from the Repubblica Metro Station - 2 - 3 minutes walk and 10 minutes down Nazionale to the Victor Emmanuel Monument. Every day I was up at around 6am and showered and dressed and down for breakfast shortly after 7am. There are about 12 tables in the breakfast room on the ground floor (up a couple of steps from the reception). The reception staff were all excellent - brilliant English and very willing to be of assistant if required. However the ladies who organised the breakfast room (and were probably part of the general housekeeping staff) had very little English but smiled and nodded at everyone. Breakfast consisted of cereal (which I don't eat), two types of juice, tea, coffee, mineral water, canned fruit, yogurt, wonderful bread rolls, processed cheese, croissants, jams and some sort of cakes which I never tried. By 8am I was out of the hotel and seldom returned before 6pm. As I ate lunch out every day (very hot and humid in Rome during my stay so a long lunch was a relief) I was not really hungry by evening. So on my way back I used to get some food from the Spar on Nazionale (50m from the hotel) and return to my room for a shower and then a drink and snack before heading out for a walk for an hour or so. The area around the hotel is perfectly safe late in the evening and the hotel has 24 hour front office staff on hand. My one and only criticism (and this is not the fault of the hotel) is that there were a number of Italian guests for the first two nights and they made quite a bit of noise returning to their rooms in the early hours of the morning. Yesterday evening I returned from my day out in Rome and advised the front office clerk that I would be checking out early this morning (this is something they ask you to do). I was going to come down last thing with the total for the mini bar ( they don't take the payment slip away every day as they do in other hotels) but he asked me for the details and I gave him a very honest answer to date and said what I might consume that evening. He did a calculation and disregarded a few things and rounded the figure up to about 10 euro less than I had already used. I paid and he said that if I came down alter he would give me the receipt but I was exhausted so I had a shower and went straight to bed. This morning I arrived down before 7am and a different clerk was on duty. I checked out and he confirmed that my room was pre paid but did not query what I had used in the mini bar the previous evening. (I know I make this sound like a mini bar review but I am used to the mini bar being cleared out the day before departure). I will definitely use the Patria Hotel whenever I go to Rome again and I am planning my next trip. The hotel is dated but clean. The staff are friendly even if they don't speak a lot of English. The locations is great. The towels may be of the thin variety but they definitely dry you and are replaced every day. My room looked over the back of the hotel and looked on to a residential block opposite. Even though the air conditioning was excellent I sometimes used to look out the window in the early morning or late in the evening and could see two things - Romans going about their daily lives opposite and smokers in the Patria who were semi abiding with the Italian non smoking room by smoking out their windows. Yes i will be back - for location the hotel cannot be bettered in its price range but also the warmth of welcome was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “it was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Heva_23
Reviews.Content: on arriving at hotel patria at about 12 our room was ready! FANTASTIC! the hotel is just what we needed. our twin room was great and more than adequately sized. fair enough the towels are like tea towels and table cloths, but hey, they do they job well. its excellently located and in walking distance of some great sights. i would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting rome to do the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very dated”
Reviews.Author: dwardy
Reviews.Content: We travelled in the world's smallest elevator to the 1950s, when this room was last updated. There was a musty smell and the bed didn't seem to have originated as a double- perhaps two smaller beds pushed together? Location is good, as you can quickly get to the trains. I wouldn't advise wandering about the neighborhood at night if you're accustomed to American suburbs.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed one bit with Hotel Patria Rome”
Reviews.Author: venusbathstravel
Reviews.Content: After arriving at their partner Hotel Augustea we were told the airconditioner wasn't working and were taken to Hotel Patria. We were tolerant of the problem but the room we were given was dirty; the bathroom had not been cleaned and the fridge had lumps of food in it. This problem was soon rectified but then we found the flush in the toilet wouldn't work; my husband could manage it but I couldn't. In the evening we discovered the light switch in the bathroom was broken and showered in semi-darkness. It took us the whole week we were there to have both these problems fixed. They glued the light switch twice (it was dangerous and it broke again both times) before replacing it. Breakfast was poor, the worst we had in our month in Italy, but would have been better if we could have got a seat without a long wait on the stairwell. Some days I gave up and picked up a couple of rolls and took them back to the room. The room was dark and had a tiny window facing a nearby wall but the bed was comfortable and the airconditioning was good. And the lift was fine on the days it was working. The hotel is in a good position.

Reviews.Title: “If this is a 3 star hotel, I'd hate to see what 2 stars looks like!”
Reviews.Author: masala_chips
Reviews.Content: As we walked into the hotel we were overwhelmed by a strong and over powering odor lingering in the lobby. We soon discovered that it was B.O. from the bell boy! Things got much worse when we discovered that the elevator only went up to the 4rth floor, and so we had to lug our heavy suitcases up the stairs, to get to our room on the 5th floor. The room was ok...I mean I didn't exactly expect chocolates on our pillows, but I did expect the basics, like towels for examples. But there were no towels! Instead we had to dry ourselves with what appeared to be over sized tea cloths! Breakfast was horrendous! In fact, after the first time, we never went back. There was one kind of really bad cereal, like corn flakes or something. A bowl of nasty canned fruit, not even fresh fruit. No toast or bagels or anything, instead they had stale dinner rolls. A plate of ham and cheese slices. And stale croissants. After traveling to Florence and Venice, we came back to Hotel Patria in Rome, for the last part of our trip. This time we were lucky to get a room on the 4rth floor, so we could take our luggage all the way up on the elevator. Unfortunately that came with a price. The shower in the new room kept getting clogged, and every morning we had to shower with our feet in 2 inches of water. This was probably the crappiest hotel I've ever stayed at, and for that price, would not recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better...”
Reviews.Author: samosa123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Patria for the first and last part of the stay of our trip to Rome. The first part we were put on the 5th floor. The room was small but had all the basic needs. It would have been nice to have fluffy towels rather than tea-cloth like ones but that was the least of my complaints. The hotel could have been cleaner, more updated. The location was great for it was close to termini station so we were able to walk with our luggage with no problems. The hotel was a bit of a challenge to find at first because it is located on a small side street and the map off the hotel website isn't clear because the road names in Rome are small and hidden on the side of the wall. Once it was found it was hard to believe we missed it in the first place. It was close to the metro and we walked to all the tourist sites including the colliseum, trevi fountain, forum, spanish steps etc. The only place we took the metro to was the vatican which was also easy to find and we bought a 24 hour metro pass which allowed us to freely use the subway to get around. The breakfast at hotel Patria was awful! We stayed at 3 different hotels on our stay and Patria had the worse breakfast. You were given stale buns/croissants, canned fruit, ham, jam, cereal. It was not appetizing so we would go to the grocery store and get food there. The grocery store is about a 5 minute walk down the main street so we would get fruits/veggies and store them in the minibar. If you do want to go out to eat beware of "ZEUS". This restaurant is just near the hotel, the food is awful! In desperation we went in cause we were so hungry and busted up $45 euros for the worse food ever. The bean soup was salty and watery, the pizza had canned mushrooms and was not fresh. We got a tempura dish that was so oily and tasteless. They will have people outside the restaurant trying to get you to come in but don't waste your money. We really loved this cafe right at Republica near the fountain. The cappincinos were reasonable, service good and you could sit outside and enjoy the view. The second part of our stay when we came back, we got put on the 4th floor. The room was a bit nicer BUT the shower kept flooding/blocking. Overall the place is ok, it did the trick for us because we were on a budget. Do yourself a favor and just eat breakfast elsewhere and don't bother bringing your laptop for they have no Wifi and the internet is downstairs in the lobby and it can be slow.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better for the money”
Reviews.Author: zsiberian
Reviews.Content: We've asked to switch rooms as soon as we walked in ours only to find out that all of them are just as nasty. (Read on for the resolution) Not like terribly nasty but imagine a what must have been green carpet from the 80's, (shaggy) with banged up furniture and questionable bed covers. We were told that smoking is permitted in all the rooms, you can imagine what that does to the room. The trick is to request/book a room on the top floor (no carpet there, just tile) if you don't mind stairs because the elevator only goes to 4th floor. We've asked twice, and on the third time a different clerk on duty took care of us and gave us a room on the top floor. Breakfast was so unappetizing that we (though very conservative with money) bought our own groceries like fruit and yogurt for the remainder of the stay. Overall we feel this place hasn't had an update since it opened, it was a drag having to come back there after a day of sightseeing so I'd say do yourself a favor and find a better recommended place even if it will be a few euros more

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: wsucoug88
Reviews.Content: This was the first trip to Europe for my wife and I and although we had read plenty of reviews about how hotel room sizes and amenities differ overseas we were not quite prepared for what we saw when we arrived at the Hotel Patria after a day of flying in from California. We purchased our standard, double room in advance and we were, of course, extremely tired by the time we arrived at the hotel. Our double room was only a few feet wider and longer than the double bed that we were to sleep on. Quite a shock considering what we were used to with hotels in the states. And even though we thought we were prepared for the smaller size we had no clue that we would barely be able to squeeze our bags into the room (and we traveled pretty light). However, to the benefit of the hotel they were kind enough to switch us to a larger room (although the bed was the same size) at no additional cost and even moved our bags to the new room while we were out discovering the city. The bathroom was small but updated and we passed on the free continental breakfast as it consisted mostly of pastries, fruit cocktail and assorted cereals. Plus, the breakfast room was always full with other hotel patrons when we did decide to eat at the hotel so we just stopped going in. There are several bakeries and small food stands nearby if you need some fuel to start your day. As others have posted, it is a great starting location for just about any trip that you are planning for the day. We quickly educated ourselves on the subway (which is right around the corner from the hotel) and found that a highly effective way to get to a majority of the sites we wanted to see. We also found that many of the restaurants and pizzerias in the area around the hotel seem to cater to the tourists and they have no trouble with speaking English if your Italian is rusty. If possible, I would suggested that you try to book a room that is away from the street as the folks in Rome seem to have a love affair with their car horns regardless of the time of day. Although the hotel worked to make our stay enjoyable it is doubtful that I would return on a future trip as my wife and I would probably seek a larger living space and quieter surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we thought”
Reviews.Author: Diedre_8
Reviews.Content: We were booking into this hotel only to find when we arrived we were moved to a hotel around the corner called Hotel Augustea. It had air con which did not work. Location was OK not far from the train station. It was clean enough but the entry into the hotel was quite ordinary almost a little disturbing. If I had have been travelling with a girlfriend and not my husband I would have perhaps been a little frightened as it was quite derelict looking. The staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: Missanne1959
Reviews.Content: I stayed here four nights in mid-April. The hotel is easy to get to from Piazza della Repubblica metro station, a bit of a hike from Termini station if you have luggage. The single room I had was "cozy" - small but there was a closet large enough for me and a desk. Flat screen TVs had CNN/BBC, that was nice - just realize that you have to turn it on from the top of the screen. Remote only works to change channels, volume. Bathroom was marble, very nice, but the weirdest layout. They crammed sink, bidet, toilet and tub into a tiny room. Use caution taking a shower - water easily gets allover the floor (so THAT's why there's a drain in the middle of the marble floor!) and it is SLICK when wet. Housekeeping was excellent. Room was very clean. Even though the reception staff wasn't very friendly, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: sushi3
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel at a reasonable price for just two nights. Location wasn't bad and the price was good. Near train station and restaurants. Room was huge but bathoom small. Weird bathroom set up. Bidet and toilet facing each other about six inches away from the bathtub which was very high to climb into. Breakfast was the worst (canned fruit cocktail!). Public area small but nice decor and front desk was helpful. Arranged for a taxi to take us to the airport. Let them know a day ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this one!”
Reviews.Author: GoulashGal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value for its location, clealiness, and helpful staff. Our room was small but it was very clean. The bathroom was a good size and modern. We laughed at the thin towels but they did the job. The staff was very helpful in recommending places to eat. The elevator only goes to the 4th floor and it is very small - two people at the most with small luggage. Don't take a room on the 5th floor unless you can do stairs. The breakfast is average and only has six tables. (The elevator doesn't go to the basement either) I sat on the stairs enjoying my coffee until a table became free - perhaps a 10 minute wait. We wanted to be near Termini (the main train station) due to an early flight out and excess to good public transportation. This is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 star Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ScottnAude
Reviews.Content: This is a Great, clean but small Hotel (with small lift). It is in close proximity of the Train station (termini) 5 minute walk and only about 15 - 20 minutes walk to most of Rome's main attractions. Breakfast is adequate but minimal space and tables. Shower cabins are not made for bigger people. Service was warm and friendly. Would recommend this hotel for a 1 week stay in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: RLevy1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, but needs a little redecorating. The style seems a bit outdated. We stayed in two different rooms - both triples. The first room was very tight. The third bed seemed to just have been dropped in the middle of the room. The second room was much roomier. Both rooms had a working refrigerator and the air conditioning was definitely a plus. Via Torino is very close to the Repubblica metro station, and there are a bunch of shops and things to do around there. However, it's a bit of a walk to any of the real sites, and we spent most of our time walking because the metro in Rome is not the best. The staff were not looking to socialize. They give you your room key, and that's it. Maybe it's because none of us spoke Italian. I would recommend the hotel for a casual trip. You won't find romance at the Patria Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Maxine527
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were friendly and welcoming upon arrival. The location is ideal as it's only a few minutes from the Termini Train Station. Our room was small but air conditioned with a fridge and safe (ours worked!). The bathroom was a good size and the room generally met all our needs - somewhere to sleep and freshen up between visits to see the wonderful sights of Rome. The breakfast room is small - but we never had to wait for a table and we had no problem with it at all - food was adequate and enough to keep us going until lunch. The location of the hotel was the biggest advantage we thought. It's central and near to a busy square with cafes and bars, shops (even a Spar supermarket) depending on whether you like sitting drinking coffee or beer, or buy your own to sit and eat in the park near Villa Borghese. We will definitely go back to Rome (we did the Trevi Fountain coin thing, so we must!) and will try to stay at the Patria Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Corsette
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, very average breakfast. Most of the staff were reasonable friendly & helpful but the cleaners probably need a bit more training. (they leave the dirty sheets right in the way or next to doors where someone can easily trip). We had been travelling for a while & were tired so we tried to sleep in one of the morning but this was not possible because the cleaners talk to each other very loudly (from room to room) while they clean. The room was average & small. The safe in the room did not work & the spare pillow & blanket did not look clean so they could not be used. In addition, the lifts only take you to level 4 so if you are on lvl 5 you can only use the lift for part of your trip & then you have to use the steps, which is not a big deal but could potentially be inconvenient for people with injuries. We moved to another hotel in the same street (Rex) on the third night and it was three times better & only paid half of the price.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy hotel, will go back.”
Reviews.Author: blondenyc3
Reviews.Content: I was there from june 30 to july 5th with my daughter. There were some little problems with our room at the beginning but nothing that would spoil our stay. Front desk was quick to fix and help with everything we needed. They are very knowledgeable, polite and helpful. The breakfast was good and the room where is served is very cozy and pleasant. They should try to have a better tasting, quality coffee, everything else was good except the coffee. Million of thanks to the gentlemen that we got to know at the front desk. Denise, Stephen, Peter, and Angelo who happened to be there when we needed the room changed and he made it perfect by giving us a room that was just what we were looking for. I would gladly go back to this hotel if in Rome again. Thanks again for making our stay there a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy & Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PerthTraveller7
Reviews.Content: Hotel Patria was the first of our Europe hotels as Rome was our 1st stop. We found it to be clean & cosy with friendly staff, some who spoke fairly fluent English and were quite helpful. Our Room 202 on the 5th floor was small though clean and had a lovely Italian tiled ensuite with modern fittings. The aircond worked perfectly and especially as it was hot when we were there. The breakfast room tho small was cosy and the breakfast was substantial. The hotel was very close to most of the touristy spots like the Trevi Fountain (20 mins walk), Pantheon, Spanish Steps and some great shopping strips. Our only complaints were the paper thin bath towels and napkin like face towels and the tiniest lift. But then again, most of the lifts in Europe are tiny! Diagonally across from the hotel was Dagnino Cafe which we developed a culinary affection for. A "Have to Visit" cafe! Yum...Another lovely cafe to eat at is Zeus Ristorante near the hotel. It is reasonably priced and tastefully decorated and served delicious meals and desserts. Check out San Crispino Gelati shop near the Trevi Fountain, serves the best and varied types of ice creams! Also worth visiting and dining at is at the Pantheon (best cafe latte/cappucino) and Piazza Navona. The Vatican City and museums & St Peter's Basilica Line are worth seeing though quite challenging in the queues to get in on a hot summer day! The St Peter's Cathedral is breathtaking! Next time we visit Rome, we shall do so in the cooler months. All in all, our trip to Rome with the heat wave at that time, was made pleasant by a comfortable aircond hotel room to get back to each time after a long sightseeing day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JAtrip
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel in may 2007 and my experience is globaly good. The hotel location is great , the Subway is a minute away and you have buses almost at the door. The staff are very helpfull and friendly, the rooms are average. The downsize is the breakfast room, its small, and i mean small, only about 6 tables, the first day i had to wait for a table the following days I took my breakfast elsewere, the quality is acceptable for a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good with the Bad”
Reviews.Author: Tuscan01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Patria twice whilst in Italy late last year. The location is excellent, very close to train station, colosseum, trevi fountain, etc but had a couple of issues with one of the male staff members. He was overly friendly and followed myself and my other female companion to our room and actually came inside without invitation. He was sleazy and made me feel uncomfortable about walking around the hotel alone. Maybe just being friendly but my instincts told me otherwise. Apart from that, the Hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: LesleyJP
Reviews.Content: Small Rooms but clean and the location was perfect for walking everywhere. Reception very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: Dudley93
Reviews.Content: Hotel close to railway station. Tiny lift and dark rooms. Very pleasant staff and a breakfast room in the cellar that was surprisingly pleasant. Close to a number of restaurants and not too far from amazing shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: toxa26
Reviews.Content: This was the cheapest place I could find within walking distance to most of the major attractions. The coliseum was 5 minutes away, the opera house is literaly next door, and the subway (the best way to get around!) is on the corner. The room was tiny, but clean. There was a breakfast, but my wife and I didnt get to try it. We were in Rome and wanted to try more "roman" things. My view on this place is, if you are looking for a clean and comfy place to sleep, but sleep is about all you'll be doing there, this is a spot for you. If you are one of those picky people how will have a screaming fit if your toilet paper roll doesnt have its end folded nicely, look else where.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room/bed!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerNorway
Reviews.Content: The Patria Hotel is nicely located, and that was why we choosed it for our weekend in Rome. But we didnt expect our room to be so tiny! Not to mention the bed. We thougt it to be a singleroom and asked for another room, but that was not possible. We managed to sleep there, but I wonder how it would have been for people a little bit larger then us! (Bedsize: approximately 1,10X185) We have never seen such a small room in any hotel we have stayed in.. So we don't suggest this hotel if you are claustrofobic or want a good breakfast (wasn't so much food to choose among). But the location is good. And Rome was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: juliee202
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from a 4 night stay at the Patria. We have previously stayed in the Augustea which is the Patria's sister hotel and found this hotel to be of the same satisfactory standard. Our room was clean, with clean towels everyday and the staff were helpful at all times. We were unable to unlock the safe on arrival and when mentioned, the staff came to our room to sort the problem immediately. Other reviews have mentioned the small breakfast room, it is worth pointing out that breakfast can be delivered to your room free of charge. We prefer this and breakfast was received every morning within 10 minutes of phoning reception. We found the breakast to be perfectly enjoyable and kept us going until well after lunchtime. As for the issue of noise, it isn't particulary quiet but that is the price you pay for a central location and compared to the other 5 hotels I have experienced in Rome, it is no noisier than any. If you are purely looking for a base from which to explore the city then by all means stay here. If you're after luxury and plan to spend long periods at the hotel then maybe this isn't the hotel for you. We would be prepared to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location, only minutes of walk from major tourist sites. Because the hotel was well situated we nearly didn't use public transportation. The rooms in the hotel are clean and comfortable, towels were changed daily. The stuff is friendly, when we arrived we asked for a non-smoking room and our request was granted. Breakfast could have been better, but wasn't so bad either. it consisted of jucies, cereals, milk, jams, cheese and bread rolls. In total we are happy with the hotel and would reccomend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read most of the reviews and thought, it can't be that bad. Rome was our last stop and we've pre-booked our Italy holiday, but when we arrived at Patria, I was thinking "why did I not take note of those reviews". Firstly - I've asked for a non-smoking room and was put in a Smoking room. Tried changing this, but no other rooms avail. The bathroom was filthy, silvermoths crawling around, pubic hair on the floor/shower and the smell was unbearable. The cherry on the cake - the bar fridge in the room was broken and the can of coke had a expiry date of 2002!!!! I hated every single moment in that room and just wanted to get out, did not even bother to file a complaint and checked out the next day. Found a much nicer hotel down the road for less than what we paid at Hotel Patria. Maybe the other rooms at Hotel Patria are up to standerd, but our room was disgusting and we will not recommend this hotel to anyone, not even my enemies!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “happy customer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome.. stayed in the Patria. The hotel is located beside metro, and within easy walk from many of the main attractions. Room was pleasant and clean. Sheets and towels were changed each day. Wasn't what I would call a luxurous hotel but for the price its represented excellent value. Staff were friendly and helpful. (..When booking the hotel we mentioned that it was our anniversary, and there was a bottle of Champagne in the room when we got there)
